pullRequest.body:
Adds definitions for unramified, smooth and Ã©tale algebras and shows basic permanence properties.

In a follow-up PR we show that these notions are stable under base change.

Co-authored-by: Judith Ludwig <ludwig@mathi.uni-heidelberg.de>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->
- [x] depends on: #12030

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#12030~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

I think stacks project and most other sources define unramifed to be formally-unramified + finite-type instead.  
And I'd argue we should relax the condition to essentially of finite type (as in Iverson's Generic Local Structure, the main reference of my blueprint) as in #11793. I needed it there so that I could show $A$ unramified over $k$ => $\forall p, (A \otimes \overline{k})_p$ unramified over $\overline{k}$ => $\forall p, (A \otimes \overline{k})_p = \overline{k}$ is reduced => $A \otimes \overline{k}$ is reduced.

> I think stacks project and most other sources define unramifed to be formally-unramified + finite-type instead. And I'd argue we should relax the condition to essentially of finite type (as in Iverson's Generic Local Structure, the main reference of my blueprint) as in #11793. I needed it there so that I could show A unramified over k => âˆ€p,(AâŠ—kâ€•)p unramified over kâ€• => âˆ€p,(AâŠ—kâ€•)p=kâ€• is reduced => AâŠ—kâ€• is reduced.

Are you only suggesting this for unramified?
Yes for the first part. Maybe we should relax smooth and etale to require only essentially of finite presentation as well?

> Yes for the first part. Maybe we should relax smooth and etale to require only essentially of finite presentation as well?

Let's continue this discussion on [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Etale.20.2F.20Smooth.20.2F.20Unramified.20etc.2E/near/432555903).
I changed the definition of unramified as suggested (to form. unram. + finite type) and adapted the results.

It looks to me like this is the consensus on Zulip. I've left a comment about a docstring and marked it awaiting-author but otherwise this looks good to go. Thanks a lot!

bors d+

:v: chrisflav can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8720598076/job/23922466469)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8720598076/job/23922465950)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8720598076/job/23922466698)

Given that there is more than one definition in the literature, I think that the docstring should definitely mention this and perhaps explain that we are using the stacks definition rather than the EGA definition (there is a correct way to format references so that they work in the API docs BTW). Other than that, this looks ready to go to me.
We added a remark to the docstring. Maybe we should make a separate PR adding all the common alg.geo references to the bibliography.

```suggestion
theorem comp [Smooth R A] [Smooth A B] : Smooth R B where
```
Maybe merge master and make `finitePresentation` an instance as well? Same for the other two.
Is there a reason why this has an default argument (and not the other two)?
no, thanks for spotting this

```suggestion
/-- Ã‰tale is stable under composition. -/
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Etale): add definition of unramified, smooth and etale
